_description: Known consent-state cookies set by Consent Management Platforms (CMPs) and privacy frameworks. These cookies store user consent preferences and should be distinguished from tracking cookies in privacy analysis.
_source: Compiled from IAB TCF specification, CMP documentation, and common CMP implementations

euconsent-v2.description: IAB TCF v2 consent string (TC String). Base64url-encoded binary format containing vendor consents, purpose consents, legitimate interest flags, and publisher restrictions.
euconsent-v2.notes: The primary consent signal for IAB TCF. Its presence indicates the site uses TCF. The encoded string can be decoded to verify which vendors and purposes have consent.

addtl_consent.description: Google Additional Consent Mode string. Lists non-IAB vendors that have received consent through a Google-certified CMP.
addtl_consent.notes: Supplements the TC String for Google Ad Manager vendors not registered with IAB.

__tcfapi.description: Not a cookie but a JavaScript API. TCF CMPs expose window.__tcfapi() for vendors to query consent status programmatically.
__tcfapi.notes: Presence of this API in page JavaScript indicates TCF compliance attempt.

OptanonConsent.description: OneTrust consent preferences cookie. Stores user's category-level consent choices.
OptanonConsent.format: URL-encoded key-value pairs including groups with consent flags
OptanonConsent.notes: Very common CMP. Groups field shows which cookie categories were accepted (1) or rejected (0).

OptanonAlertBoxClosed.description: OneTrust timestamp recording when the user dismissed the cookie banner.

CookieConsent.description: Cookiebot consent preferences. Stores granular consent state per category.
CookieConsent.format: URL-encoded JSON with stamp, necessary, preferences, statistics, marketing flags

CookieConsentPolicy.description: Salesforce/Commerce Cloud cookie consent policy flag.

didomi_token.description: Didomi CMP consent token. JWT-like token containing user consent preferences.
didomi_token.format: Base64-encoded JSON with purposes, vendors, and consent timestamp

usprivacy.description: US Privacy String (CCPA/CPRA). Four-character string encoding US privacy signal: version, notice given, opt-out sale, LSPA covered.
usprivacy.notes: 1YNN = version 1, notice given, no opt-out of sale, no LSPA. Being replaced by GPP.

__cmpcc.description: Generic CMP consent cookie. Used by various CMP implementations.

cookielawinfo-checkbox-necessary.description: Cookie Law Info (GDPR Cookie Consent) WordPress plugin consent flag for necessary cookies.
cookielawinfo-checkbox-necessary.set_by: Cookie Law Info / GDPR Cookie Consent WordPress plugin

cookielawinfo-checkbox-analytics.description: Cookie Law Info consent flag for analytics cookies.
cookielawinfo-checkbox-analytics.set_by: Cookie Law Info / GDPR Cookie Consent WordPress plugin

cookielawinfo-checkbox-advertisement.description: Cookie Law Info consent flag for advertisement cookies.
cookielawinfo-checkbox-advertisement.set_by: Cookie Law Info / GDPR Cookie Consent WordPress plugin

truste.eu.cookie.notice_gdpr_pr498.description: TrustArc (formerly TRUSTe) GDPR consent notice cookie.

notice_preferences.description: TrustArc consent preferences for cookie categories.

consent.description: Google consent cookie for YouTube and Google services.

SOCS.description: Google Search consent cookie storing consent preferences.

GPC_SIGNAL.description: Global Privacy Control signal cookie. Mirrors the Sec-GPC HTTP header.
GPC_SIGNAL.notes: GPC is a browser-level signal that can also be stored as a cookie.
